Nahum__01.1: The burden of Ninive. The book of the vision of Nahum the Elcesite.
Nahum__01.2: The Lord is a jealous God, and a revenger: the Lord is a revenger, and hath wrath: the Lord taketh vengeance on his adversaries, and he is angry with his enemies.
Nahum__01.3: The Lord is patient, and great in power, and will not cleanse and acquit the guilty. The Lord's ways are in a tempest, and a whirlwind, and clouds are the dust of his feet.
Nahum__01.4: He rebuketh the sea, and drieth it up: and bringeth all the rivers to be a desert. Basan languisheth and Carmel: and the flower of Libanus fadeth away.
Nahum__01.5: The mountains tremble at him, and the hills are made desolate: and the earth hath quaked at his presence, and the world, and all that dwell therein.
Nahum__01.6: Who can stand before the face of his indignation? and who shall resist in the fierceness of his anger? his indignation is poured out like fire: and the rocks are melted by him.
Nahum__01.7: The Lord is good and giveth strength in the day of trouble: and knoweth them that hope in him.
Nahum__01.8: But with a flood that passeth by, he will make an utter end <u>of the place thereof</u>: and darkness shall pursue his enemies.
Nahum__01.9: What do ye devise against the Lord? he will make an utter end: there shall not rise a double affliction.
Nahum__01.10: For as thorns embrace one another: so while they are feasting and drinking together, they shall be consumed as stubble that is fully dry.
Nahum__01.11: Out of thee <u>shall come forth one</u> that imagineth evil against the Lord, contriving treachery in his mind.
Nahum__01.12: Thus saith the Lord: <u>Though they were perfect</u>: and many of them so, yet thus shall they be cut off, and he shall pass: I have afflicted thee, and I will afflict thee no more.
Nahum__01.13: And now I will break in pieces his rod with which he struck thy back, and I will burst thy bonds asunder.
Nahum__01.14: And the Lord <u>will give a commandment</u> concerning thee, that no more of thy name shall be sown: I will destroy the graven and molten thing out of the house of thy God, I will make it thy grave, for thou art disgraced.
Nahum__01.15: Behold upon the mountains the feet of him that bringeth good tidings, and that preacheth peace: O Juda, keep thy festivals, and pay thy vows: for <u>Belial</u> shall no more pass through thee again, he is utterly cut off.
